description.title: Weekly Goals
description.description: Achieve consistent accuracy above 90% in prioritized Reading & Writing and Math skills while reducing hesitation on timed questions. Complete full-length practice tests under realistic conditions to build endurance and mental stamina. Strengthen confidence in decision-making by committing to answers within set time limits, minimizing unanswered questions. Refine pattern recognition to quickly identify question types and apply efficient strategies. Maintain emotional control to perform steadily under pressure, aiming to narrow score variance and lock in a reliable test-day approach.

description.title: Reading & Writing
description.description: Text Structure and Purpose, Boundaries, Central Ideas and Details, Command of Evidence - Quantitative, Cross-text Connections

description.title: Math
description.description: Percentages, Right triangles and trigonometry, Linear inequalities in one or two variables, Nonlinear equations in one variable and systems of equations in two variables

description.Text Structure and Purpose: Practice timed passage breakdowns where you identify the text structure and authorâ€™s purpose within 3 minutes per passage, annotating signal words and summarizing the main idea to reinforce quick conceptual understanding and reduce overanalysis.
description.Boundaries: Engage in sentence correction drills under a strict 30-second timer per question, focusing on identifying and fixing run-ons, comma splices, and fragments to build speed and accuracy in recognizing sentence boundaries.
description.Central Ideas and Details: Complete brief timed exercises where you read paragraphs and write one-sentence summaries of central ideas and supporting details within 2 minutes, training swift synthesis and preventing hesitation.
description.Command of Evidence - Quantitative: Work on interpreting data visuals and answering evidence-based questions with a 90-second limit each, emphasizing locating precise quantitative support and trusting initial interpretations to build confidence.
description.Cross-text Connections: Practice paired passage comparisons with a 5-minute time cap per set, annotating author purpose and tone, then quickly outlining similarities and differences to enhance synthesis speed and reduce second-guessing.

description.Percentages: Perform targeted drills converting between fractions, decimals, and percentages and solving percentage increase/decrease problems within 60 seconds each, focusing on rapid recognition and calculation without sacrificing accuracy.
description.Right triangles and trigonometry: Solve right triangle problems using sine, cosine, and tangent with a 90-second timer per question, emphasizing diagram labeling and quick ratio selection to build fluency and reduce overthinking.
description.Linear inequalities in one or two variab: Practice translating word problems into inequalities and solving them under a 2-minute limit per problem, reinforcing swift algebraic manipulation and decision-making under time pressure.
description.Nonlinear equations in one variable and: Work on substitution and solving quadratic-linear systems with a 3-minute timer per question, focusing on methodical steps and trusting initial solution paths to avoid hesitation.

description.title: Weekly Structure
description.description: Each weekday includes focused dual-skill practice sessions pairing one Math and one Reading & Writing skill, starting the week with your weakest areas to maximize improvement when mental energy is highest. Midweek shifts to moderate skills to maintain momentum, while Fridays are dedicated to comprehensive review of errors and strategy refinement. Saturdays feature two full-length, timed practice tests simulating real exam conditions to build endurance and confidence, followed by detailed mistake analysis and reflection. Sundays serve as a Flex Day for rest and adaptive activities aligned with your learning style.

description.title: Flex Day Activities
description.description: Engage in reflective journaling focused on moments when you trusted your instincts and answered confidently, reinforcing positive decision-making habits. Experiment with new study tools or timing apps to discover techniques that enhance your pace without compromising accuracy. Tackle mixed-skill challenge sets at a relaxed pace to stimulate intellectual curiosity without pressure. Incorporate mindfulness exercises or light physical activity to reset cognitive energy and maintain emotional steadiness. Set clear, purpose-driven goals for the upcoming week, aligning your study with your deeper motivations.
